natural_language_criteria: Scholarship for girl students aged 6–18 belonging to Below Poverty Line families. Students must be enrolled in government schools.
For widows of deceased farmers aged 30 to 60 belonging to BPL families in Madhya Pradesh. Only one member per family can claim benefits.

scheme_name: Girl Child Primary Education Incentive Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Provides financial incentives to girl students aged 5 to 12 enrolled in government primary schools. Only applicable for families with income up to ₹60,000 annually.
Provides training and apprenticeship to unemployed youth aged 18-30 with minimum secondary education qualification.
Students of classes 9 to 12 with excellent academic scores and parental income below ₹200,000 are eligible statewide.
Targets the poorest families with valid Antyodaya ration cards. Coverage includes rural households with family size up to 8 members.

scheme_name: Child Health Insurance and Wellness Plan
natural_language_criteria: Covers children up to 12 years aged belonging to families earning under ₹90,000 per year. Priority to BPL ration card holders.
Assists low-income families with nutritional supplements and consulting services. BPL families with up to 8 members are eligible in Rajasthan.
Provides soft loans to youth aged 20 to 40 who are unemployed or self-employed. Household income should be less than ₹250,000.
Supports handloom weavers with skill modernization and livelihood creation. Eligible weavers aged 18–45 belonging to OBC category in Churu district.
Provides job skill training for unemployed graduates aged 21–35 from Below Poverty Line families. Priority given to female candidates.

scheme_name: Rural Skill and Employment Connect Program
natural_language_criteria: Provides employment and training to rural citizens aged 18–45 from BPL or SC categories. Candidates with prior training scheme benefits are excluded.
Provides skill training to rural youth aged 20–40 with basic education. Priority is given to SC and ST categories residing in Udaipur district.
Provides monthly pension to widows aged between 40 and 70 years from Below Poverty Line families. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat and not availing similar benefits under other schemes.
Monetary allowance for unemployed youth aged 20–30 belonging to low-income BPL families. Residents of Jaipur district are prioritized.
For graduate students aged up to 25 preparing for competitive exams. Annual income cap is ₹200,000 and preference to OBC and SC categories.

scheme_name: Middle Income Group Housing Loan Subsidy
natural_language_criteria: Families belonging to the Middle Income Group (₹200,000–₹300,000 annual income) without any existing home can avail of loan interest subsidies.
This pension plan supports people aged 65 years and above who belong to BPL families. Applicants must be residents of Maharashtra and not receiving any other pension benefits.
Supports widows aged between 18 and 59 years from Below Poverty Line households residing in Rajasthan. Not applicable to those already receiving family pensions.
Provides assistance for constructing houses to BPL families who do not own any land or property. Family size should not exceed six members.
Provides financial grant to rural female students of primary and secondary education aged between 6 and 16. Family income should not exceed ₹80,000.
Provides scholarships to OBC students pursuing post-secondary education in government or recognized institutions. Annual income of parents should not exceed ₹150,000.
Provides free food grains to disabled persons in BPL families. Must have valid ration card and reside in registered block.
Citizens aged 60 years and above, belonging to Below Poverty Line category and not receiving any other pension benefits, are eligible across participating states.
Targets female-headed families below poverty line with family size up to 5. Must possess ration card under NFSA norms.

scheme_name: Social Security Pension for Marginalized Communities
natural_language_criteria: Ensures regular financial support for citizens aged above 58 years from SC, ST, or OBC categories living in Assam. Only one family member can avail the benefit.
Provides low-interest loans for self-employed women aged 20–45 from BPL households. Applicants must not have availed prior loan-based government schemes.
Covers disabled workers aged 18–60 with at least 40% disability from BPL families. Must not have availed any other health insurance scheme previously.
Covers rural families from Below Poverty Line category without any pucca house. Beneficiaries should not own residential land.

scheme_name: Women Skill Training and Employment Program
natural_language_criteria: Provides free job-oriented training for women aged 18–40 belonging to BPL families. Training centers available in Alwar district.
Girls aged 5 to 15 years from Below Poverty Line families in Gujarat are eligible for free education in government institutions.
Targets adult women aged 30 to 60 with income up to ₹150,000. Special camps organized in Barmer district for free blood tests and consultancy.
Provides critical illness coverage for workers aged 18–60 earning up to ₹200,000 annually. Must be registered laborers without prior insurance enrollment.
Supports unemployed minority women aged 21–40 holding graduate degrees. Helps them secure salaried or self-employment roles.
Subsidy for small farmers owning land up to 6 acres. Applicants should be aged 18–60 and registered under district agriculture office.
Provides free food grains to Below Poverty Line families with valid BPL ration cards. Priority is given to households with up to 7 members in Jaipur district.
Provides financial assistance to Below Poverty Line families with no land or house ownership and income less than ₹120,000 annually.
Provides permanent housing to residents of registered slum areas in Rajasthan who do not own any property. Family income must be under ₹150,000.
Targets artisans aged 60 years and above belonging to economically weaker sections in Madhya Pradesh. Not for those availing commercial or industrial pensions.
For tribal individuals aged 18 to 50 from Below Poverty Line families to access bank accounts and small business loans.
Subsidized farm machinery for small farmers with 1–5 acres of land. Preference for SC/ST and BPL households.
Financial relief for farmers aged 65 and above in Gujarat having annual income under the APL threshold. Applicants must not avail any central or state government pension.
Eligible BPL families receive 5kg wheat per person monthly. Valid ration card and registration in the district PDS system required.

Applicable for families residing in rural districts with total annual income not exceeding ₹180,000. Priority is given to households with disabled or elderly members and holding valid BPL ration cards. Families must contain at least four members.

scheme_name: PM Formalization of Micro Units Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Encourages micro and small startups by providing loans to self-employed individuals aged 18 to 55 years with income under ₹250,000.
Provides free immunization to children below 15 years. Special focus on families with income below ₹70,000 belonging to Scheduled Tribe categories.
Families residing in rural Gujarat districts with valid BPL ration cards and annual income below ₹80,000 are entitled to free medical treatment.
Ensures 150 days of work for rural unemployed families with income below ₹200,000. Members aged 18–60 and possessing BPL ration cards are eligible.
Provides affordable housing to urban poor families with annual income below ₹300,000. Beneficiaries must not own any house or land in their name.
Scholarship for girl students aged 12–18 studying in government schools. Family income should be under ₹120,000.
Available to families in Rajasthan with income up to ₹100,000 annually and not exceeding 6 family members. Priority to SC and OBC categories.
Provides monthly pension to widowed or single individuals aged 40–65 with annual income under ₹120,000. Must not receive benefits from any central scheme.
Offers financial assistance to minority community students pursuing higher education with annual family income under ₹250,000. Students must have passed their previous exams with at least 50% marks.
Provides housing benefits to low-income families affected by redevelopment projects. Families must have income below ₹180,000 and no alternate property.
Offers internships to unemployed graduates aged 21–35 who have not participated in any prior government internship. Annual family income must not exceed ₹250,000.
For farmers aged 18 to 55 possessing agricultural land less than 6 acres. Applicants must belong to EWS or OBC categories.

scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Higher Study Abroad Scheme
natural_language_criteria: For students pursuing higher education abroad with parental income less than ₹300,000. Applicants must be permanent residents of Madhya Pradesh.

scheme_name: Water Conservation and Crop Diversification Plan
natural_language_criteria: Supports small farmers owning 1–6 acres of land in arid districts to adopt drip irrigation and crop rotation. Preference is given to BPL and SC/ST farmers aged 18–65.
For elderly persons aged 70 and above in Madhya Pradesh whose family annual income is below the poverty line threshold. No other pension benefits should be active.
Designed for girls aged 5 to 15 studying in government schools. Only for students from families with income up to ₹120,000 per annum.
Supports widows aged 30 to 65 who have no income source. Eligibility includes Below Poverty Line families residing in Delhi.
Enables low-income families in Rajasthan to acquire affordable homes. Families must not own land or an existing property in any district.
Targets Scheduled Caste women-headed families below ₹120,000 income mark. Applicant must not have any existing property in Rajasthan.
Distributes essential food grains at subsidized rates to BPL families holding valid ration cards in Madhya Pradesh districts.
Offers nutritional grants to BPL and SC families with ration cards and family size below 8. Families with disabled members receive additional assistance.
Aimed at urban households having annual income below ₹90,000 with family size not exceeding 5. Available in Bhopal and Indore districts.
For Rajasthan residents aged 75 and above with annual income less than the state-defined BPL threshold. Must not be drawing any similar benefit elsewhere.
For differently-abled individuals with disability percentage above 40% belonging to Below Poverty Line families in Gujarat.
For citizens aged above 60 residing in Udaipur district. Annual income limit fixed at ₹150,000 for eligibility.

This scholarship provides financial aid to students studying in classes 9 and 10 from families with income less than ₹100,000 per year. Special priority is given to SC and ST students across Rajasthan.
Provides special skill training and employment support for SC/ST youth aged 18 to 35. Applicants must be unemployed and registered job seekers.
For SC students aged 6 to 18 enrolled in recognized schools. Family income should be under ₹100,000 per annum.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana
natural_language_criteria: Provides free food grains to families holding valid BPL ration cards. Beneficiaries must be residents of designated districts under the National Food Security Act.
Offers financial grants to unemployed youth from BPL families with annual household income below ₹120,000. Must be aged between 20 and 35 years.
Ensures subsidized food grains to eligible BPL families in Rajasthan. Beneficiaries should possess valid ration cards and be registered under NFSA.
Provides solar pump subsidies to farmers with valid land ownership of 1–8 acres. Priority for Below Poverty Line families.
Supports unmarried or widowed women aged 40–60 from BPL families through monthly pension assistance.
Assists elderly widows aged above 60 across Uttarakhand. Applicants must belong to low-income groups and not receive other assistance.
Health insurance plan dedicated to SC and ST category families with income below ₹100,000. Available across Gujarat.

scheme_name: Women SHG Revolving Micro Credit Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Provides micro-credit to women Self-Help Groups aged 18–55 residing in Rajasthan. Applicable for BPL households to start business ventures.
Offers financial aid to widowed women aged 45 to 70 years in Gujarat. The beneficiaries should belong to Below Poverty Line households.
Focuses on rural women from low-income groups with family size between 3–8 and no property ownership. Applicable in Tonk district.

scheme_name: PM Financial Assistance for Handicraft Workers
natural_language_criteria: Provides soft loan facilities to handicraft workers aged 25–60 with family income below ₹180,000 per annum. Preference to SC communities.
Exclusively for women aged 18 to 45 who are unemployed. Applicants must have passed at least secondary education level.
Supports pregnant women aged 18 to 40 from Below Poverty Line families. Coverage available across Rajasthan districts with BPL ration cards.

scheme_name: Small Tribal Farmer Solar Pump Support
natural_language_criteria: Offers subsidies on solar pumps for farmers belonging to tribal communities owning 1–5 acres of land. Applicants must be aged between 25–65 and belong to Below Poverty Line families.

scheme_name: Urban Street Vendor Micro Finance Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Offers micro-financing for self-employed street vendors aged 20–55 in urban areas. Applicable only for Below Poverty Line category workers.

scheme_name: Chief Minister Startup Capital Aid Program
natural_language_criteria: For youth entrepreneurs aged 18–40 launching startups in Rajasthan. Must have annual family income below ₹300,000 and belong to general or OBC category.

scheme_name: Mother and Child Nutrition Assistance Program
natural_language_criteria: Provides nutritional kits to pregnant women and children under age five from low-income BPL families. Applicants must possess ration cards and belong to rural panchayat zones.
For citizens aged 80 or above who have no source of income and reside in Gujarat. Not available to recipients of central pensions.
Provides free rural healthcare to patients aged 10 years and above belonging to Below Poverty Line families. Applicable only in Ajmer and Tonk districts.
Supports widowed women aged 35 to 65 in rural Bihar. Only eligible for first-time applicants with household income below ₹100,000.
Focused on pregnant women from BPL households in district Pali. Beneficiaries must have registered under government maternity centers.
Women aged 20 to 50 engaged in self-employment and earning below ₹200,000 per year are eligible for low-interest credit support.
Students aged 6 to 14 in government primary/secondary schools from families below the poverty line are eligible to receive uniform assistance.
Provides financial aid for installing micro-irrigation systems for farmers with 1 to 5 acres of land. Applicable only to land-owning farmers from Below Poverty Line households.
Pays pension to senior citizens aged 60+ and widows aged 40–60 from Below Poverty Line families. Applicants receiving another pension are ineligible.
Grants financial assistance to SC/ST students pursuing graduate degrees in recognized universities with income under ₹200,000.
Provides monthly pension to widowed women aged 40 to 70 belonging to Below Poverty Line families in Rajasthan. Applicants must not be receiving any other central pension benefits.
Provides financial aid for house construction to urban Below Poverty Line families. The family must not possess any property and income should not exceed ₹150,000 per annum.

scheme_name: Mukhya Mantri Vidhwa Aarthik Sahay Yojana
natural_language_criteria: Provides monthly income support to widowed women aged above 40 years residing in Madhya Pradesh. Must not benefit from any central widow scheme.
Provides essential medical treatment for children aged up to 10 years from families earning under ₹80,000 annually in Tonk district.
Grants house subsidies to Economically Weaker Section families with income up to ₹150,000. The applicant should not own land in any municipality.
Designed for women aged 65 years and above living alone or widowed in Madhya Pradesh. Priority given to those from BPL families with no adult children support.
Low-income SC/ST families holding AAY ration cards are eligible for additional nutritional food supplies. The family must have at least two children under 14 and total income below ₹100,000 per year.
Launched for poor and vulnerable families in Madhya Pradesh. The annual family income must be below ₹80,000, and coverage is available to families up to 5 members.
Construction grant for SC families with income below ₹180,000 and no existing house ownership. The family should reside in Ajmer district.
Helps Below Poverty Line families with subsidized construction material. Applicants must own no property and reside in Jodhpur district.
Eligible women aged 25–60 from BPL families with valid ration cards can avail free cancer screening. Preference given to those not covered under other health programs.
Incentivizes female artisans aged 25–55 with family income under ₹200,000. Must belong to OBC or minority groups and not have received similar financial aid before.
Funds farm-based cooperatives led by women aged 25–55 owning farmland between 1–6 acres. Must belong to SC, ST, or OBC category and reside in rural blocks.
Provides scholarships to ST students aged 10 to 22 studying in secondary or higher education levels. Family income must not exceed ₹100,000.
Provides zero-balance bank accounts to citizens aged 18 to 60 with annual income below ₹150,000. Priority given to rural and economically weaker sections.

scheme_name: Entrepreneurship Support Mission for SC/ST Youth
natural_language_criteria: Provides startup training and grants to SC/ST youth aged 21–40 who are unemployed. Only applicable for first-time entrepreneurs from BPL families.
Encourages skill-based employment in urban sectors for youth aged 18–35 with secondary school completion. Focused on APL group families.
For graduates and postgraduates aged 22–30 currently unemployed. Designed to offer short-term internships with government institutions.
Provides financial grants to SC/ST students aged 10–25 pursuing secondary or graduate education in Jaipur district.
Offers short-term skill training to unemployed youth aged 18 to 35. Candidates must have completed at least secondary education.
Designed for Scheduled Tribe families earning below ₹150,000 without owning any property. Implemented across tribal districts of Gujarat.
Provides monthly income support to widowed women aged 30 to 60 with annual income under ₹100,000 from Below Poverty Line families.

scheme_name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
natural_language_criteria: Targets unemployed youth aged 18 to 35 from rural families. The applicant should belong to Below Poverty Line households.
Supports widows who have remarried and satisfy Below Poverty Line criteria in Madhya Pradesh. Applicable for women between 25 and 50 years.

scheme_name: PM Self Help Group Loan Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Supports female Self-Help Groups where each member’s income is under ₹120,000. Groups must include adult members aged 21 to 55.
Designed for women aged 20 to 60 belonging to Below Poverty Line families. The program includes free diagnostics and health check-ups in Rajasthan districts.
Covers maternity and hospitalization costs for women aged 18–40 from Below Poverty Line families with valid ration cards. Must reside in Rajasthan state.
Farmers aged 21–55 with 1–6 acres of land are eligible for organic farming assistance. Must be registered cultivators within the block area.
Provides grants to OBC families with annual income not exceeding ₹100,000. Applicable only to families unable to own any residential land.
A health coverage initiative for Below Poverty Line citizens under 45 years. Family income must be below ₹100,000 with valid ration card status.

scheme_name: Higher Education Grant for Tribal Girls
natural_language_criteria: Supports tribal female students aged 17 to 25 from families with annual income up to ₹150,000 pursuing graduation or above. Applicants must not have failed in past sessions and must be permanent residents of Madhya Pradesh.
Provides free food rations to senior citizens aged above 60 from BPL or SC households having valid ration cards. Applicants cannot be part of any other food scheme.
Targets unemployed youth aged 18 to 35 seeking wage or skill-based work. Beneficiaries must belong to Below Poverty Line families with secondary education or higher.
OBC students pursuing graduate-level technical courses are eligible if income does not exceed ₹200,000 annually.

scheme_name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
natural_language_criteria: This scheme offers financial assistance to senior citizens aged 60 years and above belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) households. Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Rajasthan and not receiving any other central pension benefits.
Provides residential units to families relocated from slums in Rajasthan. Must belong to low-income group and lack formal house ownership.

scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
natural_language_criteria: This scheme provides cashless treatment up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for Below Poverty Line households. The beneficiary family must have an annual income less than ₹100,000 and be registered under the SECC database.
Provides monthly ration to BPL families with valid cards. Available for households with family size less than or equal to five members.
Life insurance scheme for individuals aged 18 to 50 from low-income households with income under ₹250,000.

scheme_name: Rajasthan Mukhyamantri Chiranjeevi Swasthya Bima Yojana
natural_language_criteria: Rajasthan residents with annual family income up to ₹150,000 are eligible for free medical treatment up to ₹5 lakh. Families with ration cards under NFSA or BPL are eligible.
Provides scholarships to students aged 10 to 16 enrolled in recognized secondary schools. Priority is given to SC and OBC category students with annual family income under ₹150,000.
Ensures ration support for SC/ST and disabled individuals with valid ration cards. Family income must not exceed ₹150,000 and family size limited to six.
Provides universal healthcare card to families in Gujarat with income lower than ₹180,000 per year. Focused on families of size up to 7.
Provides loan subsidies for self-employed women aged 21–50 from SC/ST or OBC category with household income less than ₹250,000. Applicants should not be beneficiaries of any other financial scheme.
Financial support for citizens aged 65 years and above from Below Poverty Line families in Madhya Pradesh. Applicants with other government pensions are ineligible.
Encourages small savings among rural individuals aged 18 to 60 with annual income below ₹150,000. Open to all income categories under BPL.
Offers monthly income support to widows aged between 25 and 60 across Chhattisgarh. The family’s annual income must be within BPL limits.
Encourages unemployed women aged 21–45 for small business setup. Special training programs available for SC and OBC women.
Supports unemployed youth aged 21 to 45 with small business loans up to ₹10 lakh. Applicant must belong to BPL or EWS category.
Offers scholarships to students pursuing professional or technical degrees in Rajasthan universities. Family income should not exceed ₹180,000 annually.
Supports girl students aged 8 to 20 across Rajasthan pursuing primary to graduate levels. Beneficiaries must have annual family income under ₹150,000.
Provides credit guarantee for first-time homeowners with annual income below ₹300,000. Applicants must not possess any land or property and should reside in Rajasthan.
Encourages eco-friendly housing for families with income under ₹250,000 within Jaipur Metropolitan Region. Applicants must not possess any registered property.
Grants pension to citizens aged above 60 belonging to BPL or SC categories. Applicants must not get state employee pensions or similar aid.
Provides assistance to small and marginal farmers owning up to 5 acres with annual income below ₹180,000. Applicants must not receive any existing government subsidy.

Eligible for urban residents belonging to Economically Weaker Sections with annual income under ₹200,000 and family size between three and seven. Applicants must not have property in their name and must be residents of designated cities.
Provides pulses and grains at subsidized rates for SC/ST families holding valid BPL cards. Available in designated Rajasthan districts.
Empowers widows above 45 years of age in Gujarat by providing monthly financial support. Only for women from Below Poverty Line households.
Targets ST community residents in specific tribal blocks like Kushalgarh and Kherwara. Only families holding valid BPL ration cards are eligible.
Supports self-employment initiatives by urban women aged 21 to 45 who are currently unemployed. Education level must be secondary or above.
Provides bank loans between ₹1 lakh and ₹10 lakh to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs aged 21 to 55 for setting up new enterprises.

scheme_name: Adult Learning and Job Readiness Initiative
natural_language_criteria: Targets semi-literate adults aged 25–45 from Below Poverty Line families. Applicants must not have participated in previous government literacy drives.
For unemployed youth aged 18 to 35 seeking self-employment loans. Requires household income below ₹200,000.
Subsidy for employers hiring graduates aged 21–30 for full-time jobs. Candidates must belong to BPL families and have not previously benefited from job subsidies.

scheme_name: Urban Senior Citizen Rental Assistance Program
natural_language_criteria: Subsidizes monthly rent for elderly citizens aged above 60 residing in urban locations. Must not own residential property and should belong to EWS group with annual income below ₹200,000.
Grants housing assistance to Below Poverty Line families residing in rural areas with family size up to 8 members. The land ownership must be verified as true.
Provides support to farmers practicing sustainable agriculture on 1–8 acres of land. Applicants must own agricultural land and reside in tribal blocks of Rajasthan.

scheme_name: Elder and Disabled Social Assistance Pension
natural_language_criteria: Provides pension for elderly citizens aged 60 and above as well as adults aged 18–60 with more than 40% disability. Beneficiaries must belong to Below Poverty Line families in Rajasthan and should not receive any other pension benefits.
Eligible for senior citizens and physically handicapped individuals holding valid BPL ration cards. Each beneficiary receives monthly food assistance.
Provides monthly pension for farmers aged 60 years and above owning less than 3 acres of agricultural land. Beneficiaries must belong to Below Poverty Line households.
Designed to assist transgender individuals aged 18 and above belonging to BPL households in Kerala. Must not be enrolled in any other pension scheme.
Unemployed rural youth aged 18–40 with secondary education from BPL families can avail of financial aid. Repeat beneficiaries are excluded.
Ensures availability of nutritious food to BPL households with children under 14 years. Must possess valid ration card and belong to registered block.
Graduate students from ST category with annual income below ₹200,000 and GPA above 7.0 are eligible. Applicants must not hold other scholarships and must reside in Rajasthan.
Provides staple food grains to Below Poverty Line families residing in remote rural areas. Beneficiaries must hold valid ration cards and belong to a recognized block.
Implemented in Indore district for families with less than 8 members and income below ₹130,000. Focuses on preventive healthcare support.
Covers Below Poverty Line households with annual income less than ₹150,000 for cashless health services. Beneficiaries must have a valid BPL ration card and belong to registered districts.
Provides supplementary ration kits in tribal blocks for ST households with up to 6 members. Applicants should hold valid BPL ration cards.
Provides medical emergency coverage to families residing in rural Madhya Pradesh districts with income below ₹120,000 and family size ≤6.
For self-employed artisans aged 18 to 50 under Below Poverty Line. Provides low-interest loans to support traditional crafts.

scheme_name: Agricultural Risk Resilience and Subsidy Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Assists farmers aged 18–65 owning 1–10 acres of land with insurance premium subsidies. Restricted to residents of Rajasthan with valid land titles.
For students belonging to OBC category pursuing post-matric education. Eligible if family income is under ₹250,000 and resident of Madhya Pradesh.

scheme_name: Old Age Family Integrity Pension Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Provides monthly pension benefits to families where both partners are aged 60 or above and belong to Below Poverty Line households of Madhya Pradesh.
Provides monthly pension to senior citizens aged 65 years and above with annual income below ₹120,000. Applicants must not be receiving any other pension benefits.
Provides scholarships to girl students aged 10 to 20 pursuing secondary or graduate education. Family income must not exceed ₹120,000.
Financial housing support for Below Poverty Line families residing in Alwar district. Beneficiaries should not own any property or land.

scheme_name: Rural Sanitation and Health Outreach Program
natural_language_criteria: Ensures regular health check-ups and sanitation drives in tribal villages. Beneficiaries must belong to Below Poverty Line families with family size ≤8.
Applicable to citizens aged 60 years or older with a minimum of 40% disability and belonging to Below Poverty Line households in Rajasthan.
Provides government-backed loan guarantees for self-employed entrepreneurs aged 21 to 60 with annual income below ₹300,000.

scheme_name: Old Age Pension for Desert Areas
natural_language_criteria: For elderly residents aged 65 or above in desert regions of Rajasthan. Income limit applicable as per BPL norms.
Applicable for families with at least one disabled member having over 40% disability and income below ₹150,000. Families must not exceed 6 members.
Provides ration subsidies to Below Poverty Line families with family size between 3 and 10 members. Eligible families must reside in Tonk and Ajmer districts with valid ration cards.
A scheme for retired farmers aged 65 and above owning agricultural land of less than 2 hectares. Applicable across Bihar state.
Provides financial assistance to small and marginal farmers owning cultivable land up to 2 hectares. Beneficiary must be an adult farmer aged 18–65.
Provides apprenticeship training and stipends for unemployed graduates and diploma holders aged 18–35. Candidates who have undergone similar programs before are ineligible.
Targets children aged below 10 years from families with income less than ₹50,000. Focused on tribal and rural areas of Rajasthan.

scheme_name: Chief Minister’s Urban Health Assistance Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Applicable for urban families residing in Jaipur district with annual income up to ₹120,000. Family size should be less than 8 members.
Applicants from low-income group with annual family income up to ₹200,000 and no property ownership are eligible for flats under this program.

scheme_name: Youth Self Employment Revolving Fund Scheme
natural_language_criteria: Provides financial backing for unemployed youth aged 18–35 from Below Poverty Line households in Gujarat interested in self-employment ventures.
For families in Madhya Pradesh with annual income up to ₹200,000 and no existing home ownership. Priority given to Below Poverty Line families.
For disabled farmers aged 25 to 65 with disability above 40%. Landholding should not exceed two hectares and applicant must reside in Punjab.
Urban Below Poverty Line families with registered ration cards are eligible for subsidized food rations. Priority for families with more than four members.
Focuses on unemployed tribal women aged 18–35 for livelihoods through skill-based jobs. Available in tribal areas of Banswara and Dungarpur.
For tribal farmers aged 18–60 owning up to 5 acres of land in Gujarat’s tribal blocks. Provides irrigation system setup subsidy. Non-beneficiaries of similar schemes get preference.
